# invert difference
correction = 0.0
if n_diff > 0:
correction = history[-n_diff]
...
# correct forecast if it was differenced
return correction + yhat[0]
Listing 15.26: Example of inverting any diﬀerencing performed.
It also means that the history must be diﬀerenced so that the input data used to make the
prediction has the expected form.
# calculate difference
history = difference(history, n_diff)
Listing 15.27: Example of diﬀerencing the history prior to making a prediction.
